intro: Senecio linariifolius var. discodeus, commonly known as the "Blue Eardrops," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, silver-gray leaves and erect flowering stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice among gardeners in arid climates.
